Articles.Content:
I Click on the KSP icon on my computer, and it crashes, stating

"KSP.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)

in module KSP.exe at 001b:00000000." (stolen from error message).

I have uninstalled KSP and re-installed removing all files in between and it still happens.

Please post the entire log files so we can have a proper look at what's going on. The specific error message is, unfortunately, not a great deal of help if we don't know precisely where the error is occurring.
You'll need to share the file publicly.

Apologies

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0Bxjehn21RDfLSktEaHJlTVRJMk0&authuser=0

I can't speak for Tao, but error.log doesnt help me much. I need either your KSP.log or, preferably, your output_log.txt.
Ok here is a link to the Output log

Actual crash:

Initialize engine version: 4.5.5f1 (7684ad0c5a44)
GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1
d3d: no support for this device type (accelerated/ref)
D3D9 initialization failed
GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1
d3d11: failed to create D3D11 device (0x887a0004)
D3D11 initialization failed
D3D9/D3D11 initialization failed, trying OpenGL
GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1
OpenGL:
    Version:  OpenGL 1.1 [1.1.0]
    Renderer: GDI Generic
    Vendor:   Microsoft Corporation
    Driver:   RDPDD 6.1.7601.17514
    VRAM:     64 MB (via fallback)
    Extensions: GL_WIN_swap_hint GL_EXT_bgra GL_EXT_paletted_texture
Crash!!!

What the heck?

It looks like your game is failing to initialize with DirectX, both 9 and 11 (I don't even know why its attempting DX11), failing, and then getting a single-threaded, 32 bit OpenGL runninng. That is then somehow failing and crashing.

I have absolutely zero idea what is going on and I'd suggest reinstalling. If the issue persists, I might suggest looking at your graphics card. I don't know much about whats going on but that might be a place to start.

Edited January 8, 2015 by Captain Sierra
censored my own surprise

hmm, I have tried a re-install two or three times with no avail, and I have used KSP with the current Graphics card (a EVGA GeForce 8400) Ill check if its a bad driver,

- - - Updated - - -

Apologies again, It appears that my graphics driver was out of date and after a quick Update KSP seems to work fine. Sorry for the inconvenience.

When in doubt, update drivers!

Glad to hear you got it working.
